column4: Is anyone else getting weird screen artefacts in Ubuntu.  If I have an app open in the foreground I always see either youtube videos or adverts for amazon come through from the background, even when a browser is minimised or closed altogether
the only way to get rid of it is to restart
this is a new problem, started at 10.10
any ideas?
strange
have you tried disabling hardware accel for flash
try disabling hardware accel for flash first :D right click flash vid -> settings -> uncheck box for accel
cheers 2sec, I thought there was a cfg file somewhere to switch it on/off
the settings is greyed out, and global settings takes me to adobe.com
try it on a youtube vid?
well thats grayed for me too... hold on
k
think I found the text file to edit /etc/adobe/mms.cfg
:O
but it doesn't exist, does flash have hw accel on by default?
go there, right click, settings :D
nice one!
the artefacts are still there, but I'll restart to see if it's fixed.... or is there another way to kill the programs running w/o restarting?
logging out would work, but if it didn't fix it, then that probably won't with a restart either
brb
that did the trick! ;)
cheers
I'd like to know whether there is a key to edit using gconf to make such an alteration
